from PyQt4 import QtGui
from PyQt4 import QtCore
from PyQt4.QtCore import Qt

from customeditor import CustomEditor



[docs]class ColorEditor(CustomEditor):

    def __init__(self, parent=None, editable=True, field_name='color', **kwargs):
        CustomEditor.__init__(self, parent)
        self.setObjectName( field_name )
        layout = QtGui.QVBoxLayout(self)
        layout.setSpacing(0)
        layout.setContentsMargins( 0, 0, 0, 0)
        self.color_button = QtGui.QPushButton(parent)
        self.color_button.setMaximumSize(QtCore.QSize(20, 20))
        layout.addWidget(self.color_button)
        if editable:
            self.color_button.clicked.connect(self.buttonClicked)
        self.setLayout(layout)
        self._color = None


[docs]    def get_value(self):
        color = self.getColor()
        if color:
            value = (color.red(), color.green(), color.blue(), color.alpha())
        else:
            value = None
        return CustomEditor.get_value(self) or value



[docs]    def set_value(self, value):
        value = CustomEditor.set_value(self, value)
        if value:
            color = QtGui.QColor()
            color.setRgb(*value)
            self.setColor(color)
        else:
            self.setColor(value)



[docs]    def getColor(self):
        return self._color



[docs]    def set_enabled(self, editable=True):
        self.color_button.setEnabled(editable)



[docs]    def setColor(self, color):
        pixmap = QtGui.QPixmap(16, 16)
        if color:
            pixmap.fill(color)
        else:
            pixmap.fill(Qt.transparent)
        self.color_button.setIcon(QtGui.QIcon(pixmap))
        self._color = color



[docs]    def buttonClicked(self, raised):
        if self._color:
            color = QtGui.QColorDialog.getColor(self._color)
        else:
            color = QtGui.QColorDialog.getColor()
        if color.isValid() and color!=self._color:
            self.setColor(color)
            self.editingFinished.emit()
